project.teaser: The project aims to decarbonize EUs fleet by improving ships heat energy system through optimization of heat flow topology with dynamic calculation model, as well as including latest advancements in heat energized technologies. In this project all major consumers, heat...
project.objective:
The project aims to decarbonize EUs fleet by improving ships heat energy system through optimization of heat flow topology with dynamic calculation model, as well as including latest advancements in heat energized technologies. In this project all major consumers, heat producers and waste heat sources are considered. Furthermore, the calculation model is planned to be validated by real-life on-board prototype, to go further from theoretical calculations and experience. Thus creating a new innovative approach towards design method of heat energy system on the ships. The main target is to reach 14% efficiency increase by the calculation and scale it down to prototype to validate.
The project is divided into three phases. First phase is concentrated on researech and development of the calculation tool based on the collected on-board data from the case study ship, with an outcome of new heat energy system topology with best efficiency based on limitations given by the ship owner. The second phase continues with development of process and system engineering for the optimized system arrangement, with an outcome of initial automation and interface principles. Third phase is a practical installation of prototype on board of the case study ship and validation of the calculation model vs real installation.
The validation will impact shipowners perception on the possibilities to upgrade their ships. Additionally will provide valuable experience to participating parties to strengthen EU companies position on the market with high-end technology and heat energy efficiency optimization on ships. The efficiency increase will help to reduce ship emissions in CO2; NOx; SOx and particulate matter which is getting critical from EU enviromnental strategies.
project.title: Holistic heat energy management on ships by implementing innovative dynamic calculation models towards maximum waste heat capture and energy efficiency
project.keywords: Energy saving, Decarbonization, ORC, Energy efficiency, Net-Zero, Vessel

result.title: Effects of electric batteries charge and discharge strategy on modern Ro-Ro vessels

details.authors: Giovanni Barone, Annamaria Buonomano, Gianluca Del Papa, Cesare Forzano, Giovanni Francesco Giuzio, Robert Maka, Adolfo Palombo, Giuseppe Russo
details.journalTitle: Conference: SDEWES 2023 - 18th Conference on Sustainable Development of Energy, Water and Environment SystemsAt: Dubrovnik (Croatia)

result.title: Integration risk analysis
result.description: Integration risk assessment evaluates possibility of economical, scheduling, operational and budgetary risks and probability what may arise during Integration of the selected system modifications. After risk and probability has been identified a countermeasure is proposed to reduce any surprises what might affect the project planned outcomes. Detailed report for the assumptions, risk matrix and results is delivered.

result.title: Improving the energy efficiency of ships: modelling, simulation, and optimization of cost-effective technologies

details.authors: Giovanni Barone, Annamaria Buonomano, Gianluca Del Papa, Cesare Forzano, Giovanni Francesco Giuzio, Robert Maka, Adolfo Palombo, Giuseppe Russo, Raffaele Vanoli
details.journalTitle: Conference: 4th International Conference on Modelling and Optimisation of Ship Energy SystemsAt: Delft, Netherland

details.authors: Annamaria Buonomano, Gianluca Del Papa, Giovanni Francesco Giuzio, Robert Maka, Adolfo Palombo

result.title: Impact study
result.description: Current project is considering existing ship retrofit. Retrofit projects on cruise ships are usually done during ship operation. Therefore, feasibility study should be made to confirm modifications proposed to fulfil calculated and selected heat energy system arrangement. It will describe the physical modifications need to be made, how it will affect ship normal operations and give detailed budget estimation required for the ship.

result.title: Prototype description and principles
result.description: It will show the scope of exact equipment and intention to be implemented on the ship. Downscaled system equipment and components are described. Deliverables are reports, documents and drawings with data described.

result.title: How to achieve energy efficiency and sustainability of large ships: a new tool to optimize the operation of on-board diesel generators

details.authors: Giovanni Barone, Annamaria Buonomano, Gianluca Del Papa, Robert Maka, Adolfo Palombo

result.title: Project website
result.description: The project-specific website that will be set up will relate the project’s results and act as an information depository that will be accessible to the public and contribute to communicating the project results. The website will also demonstrate the main outcomes of the project, e.g. the heat recovery optimization tool.

result.title: Shipping energy efficiency: dynamic model validation of an existing cruise ship through measured data

details.authors: Giovanni Barone, Annamaria Buonomano, Gianluca Del Papa, Cesare Forzano, Giovanni Francesco Giuzio, Robert Maka, Adolfo Palombo, Giuseppe Russo
details.journalTitle: Conference: SDEWES 2023 - 18th Conference on Sustainable Development of Energy, Water and Environment Systems. At: Dubrovnik (Croatia)

result.title: Existing ship efficiency
result.description: By means of the final developed simulation model, the ship energy efficiency is calculated with respect to its initial system layout (case study, D1.4) and to the considered operating and weather conditions (D1.4 and D1.5). The deliverable reports results about the modelled and simulated ship energy behaviour and efficiency.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - HEMOS (Holistic heat energy management on ships by implementing innovative dynamic calculation models towards maximum waste heat capture and energy efficiency)
result.teaser: The HEMOS project is motivated by the need to address environmental concerns in the global shipping sector. Studies indicate that the maritime industry contributes approx. 2.5-3% to global CO2 emissions, with the EU's maritime sector alone giving 14% of greenhouse gas...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
